IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE SCHOOL IS TO EDUCATE THE WHOLE STUDENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE SCHOOL IS TO EDUCATE THE WHOLE STUDENT.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND SUPPORT FOR APPROXIMATELY 595 STUDENTS IN GRADES NINE THROUGH POST-GRADUATE IN A BOARDING AND DAY SETTING.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: AUXILIARY INCOME - 2014 AMOUNT: $ 49,000. 2015 AMOUNT: $ 74,335. INSURANCE PROCEEDS - 2011 AMOUNT: $ 125,773.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS A COLLECTION OF ARTWORK WHICH IS ON PUBLIC DISPLAY THROUGHOUT ITS CAMPUS BUILDINGS. THE SCHOOL FOLLOWS A POLICY OF NOT CAPITALIZING THE COLLECTION OF ARTWORK IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ACCORDINGLY, NO COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS, WHETHER THEY ARE PURCHASED OR RECEIVED AS A CONTRIBUTION. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS REDUCE NET ASSETS IN THE PERIOD OF PURCHASE. PROCEEDS FROM SALES OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE RECORDED AS INCREASES IN NET ASSETS WHEN RECEIVED. NO ITEMS WERE PURCHASED FOR OR REMOVED FROM THE COLLECTION IN 2014 OR 2013.
COLLECTIONS ARE COMPRISED OF VARIOUS PAINTINGS AND SCULPTURES THAT ARE ON DISPLAY THROUGHTOUT THE SCHOOL FOR THE CULTURAL ENRICHMENT OF ITS STUDENT BODY.

RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR-IMPOSED STIPULATIONS. UNRESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS, INCLUDING BOARD DESIGNATED FUNDS, ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SPENDING POLICY APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

THE SCHOOL HAS NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AT JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015. THE SCHOOL'S U.S. FEDERAL INFORMATION RETURNS PRIOR TO FISCAL YEAR 2013 ARE CLOSED AND MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY EVALUATES EXPIRING STATUTES OF LIMITATIONS, AUDITS, PROPOSED SETTLEMENTS, CHANGES IN TAX LAW AND NEW AUTHORITATIVE RULINGS. IF THE SCHOOL HAD UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES, IT WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY TAX MATTERS AS PART OF THE INCOME TAX PROVISION AND INCLUDE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES WITH THE RELATED TAX LIABILITY IN THE STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS -871,782. FINANCIAL AID -7,864,454.
COST OF GOODS SOLD -354,421.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 354,421.
FINANCIAL AID 7,864,454.
NEWSPAPER MEDIA
THE LISTED INVESTMENTS RELATE TO HOLDINGS IN THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUND.
ALL FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FINANCIAL AID STATEMENT AND PROVIDE THE NECESSARY SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION.

AS THE SCHOOL OPERATES AS A BOARDING SCHOOL WITH APPROXIMATELY 480 STUDENTS RESIDING ON CAMPUS, CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS ARE REQUIRED TO RESIDE ON CAMPUS. THE VALUE OF SCHOOL HOUSING PROVIDED FOR THIS PURPOSE MEETS THE REQUIREMENT FOR TAX EXEMPTION UNDER IRC SECTION 119, AND ACCORDINGLY, IS INCLUDED IN NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS.
THE HEADMASTER PARTICIPATES IN A 457(F) PLAN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE K PART I, LINE A (E) AND PART II, COLUMN A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ISSUE PRICE AND THE TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE DO NOT AGREE DUE TO THE PREMIUM PAID BY THE SCHOOL AT ISSUANCE, WHICH IS INCLUDED IN THE ISSUE PRICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE K PART I, LINE B (E) AND PART II, COLUMN B, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ISSUE PRICE AND THE TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE DO NOT AGREE DUE TO THE PREMIUM PAID BY THE SCHOOL AT ISSUANCE, WHICH IS INCLUDED IN THE ISSUE PRICE.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION AS ENGLISH TEACHER AND AEROBICS INSTRUCTOR

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART I, (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF GIFTS RECEIVED.
THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS AN ACCOUNT WITH A FINANCIAL INSTITUTION WHICH IS USED TO ACCEPT AND SUBSEQUENTLY LIQUIDATE ALL DONATED SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSISTANT TREASURER AND THE CONTROLLER REVIEW A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990, WHICH IS FIRST REVIEWED BY THE SCHOOL'S EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL AUDIT AND FINANCIAL RISK COMMITTEE MEMBERS SEVERAL DAYS IN ADVANCE OF A SCHEDULED AUDIT AND FINANCIAL RISK COMMITTEE MEETING. HIGHLIGHTS OF THE FORM 990 ARE SUBSEQUENTLY PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT A REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETING FOR FULL BOARD DISCUSSION AND COMMENT. IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE PRIVACY OF ITS DONOR BASE, THE SCHOOL CHOOSES TO DISTRIBUTE TO THE BOARD A COPY OF FORM 990 WHICH EXCLUDES SCHEDULE B. ALL OTHER PAGES, SCHEDULES AND ATTACHMENTS ARE PROVIDED IN FULL TO THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ALL TRUSTEES, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT. ISSUES THAT PRESENT A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST RELATED TO ANY CURRENT TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE ARE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR DISCUSSION AND INCLUSION IN BOARD MINUTES. THE TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE THAT IS IDENTIFIED AS POSSIBLY HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS ASKED TO RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM THE MEETING AND DISCUSSION OF THE ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE HEADMASTER/PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION IS DETERMINED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE, INDEPENDENTLY OF THAT INDIVIDUAL, BASED UPON SURVEY DATA COLLECTED RELATED TO THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEADS OF 39 COMPARABLE BOARDING SCHOOLS. COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION, INDEPENDENTLY OF THOSE INDIVIDUALS, BASED UPON COMPENSATION DATA SURVEYED FROM THOSE SAME 39 SCHOOLS AND REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TAFT SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS -871,782.
THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES THE THE SCHOOL'S OVERSIGHT OR SELECTION PROCESSES DURING THE TAX YEAR.
